'It is Jesus who speaks through me': The enigmatic life of Marthe Robin
description: 'Marthe Robin, Saint Or Fraud?' (1/5). In the 1920s, a paralyzed and bedridden farmer's daughter became a Catholic mystic known for her supernatural visions, and crowds flocked to see her until she died in 1981.

headline: Trump says Zelensky can end war with Russia 'almost immediately,' rules out reclaiming Crimea
Israelis rally nationwide calling for end to Gaza war, hostage deal
Bolivia's presidential vote headed for first-ever runoff between centrist, right-wing candidates
description: With over 91% of the ballots counted on Sunday, Senator Rodrigo Paz had received 32.8% of the votes cast. Jorge 'Tuto' Quiroga had 26.4%. Candidates needed to surpass 50%, or 40% with a 10-point margin of victory, to avoid a runoff.

headline: Air Canada suspends plan to resume flights as union vows to continue strike
description:
The Canadian Union of Public Employees (CUPE), which is representing the workers, sought wage increases as well as to address uncompensated ground work, including during the boarding process, announcing on Sunday that the strike would continue.
The union urged passengers not to go to the airport if they had a ticket for Air Canada.

headline: Soviet-era relics in Kazakhstan rescued from ruin
description: The monumental mosaics and frescoes adorning public buildings in the former Soviet republic are at risk of disappearing and initiatives to restore these works of art are proliferating.

headline: The lobo-guará, Brazil's maned wolf, a national icon under threat
description: Emblematic of the Cerrado, these animals have seen their habitat fragmented by deforestation and the spread of industrial agriculture. In the state of Minas Gerais, a sanctuary now shelters some of them, aiming to raise public awareness.

'Who will survive?': How 'Game of Thrones' staged an unprecedented bloodbath
description: 'Breaking the Script' (4/5). On June 2, 2013, the end of the third season of 'Game of Thrones' stunned viewers by depicting the brutal murder of one of the saga's houses, in an episode that immediately went viral on social media. The carnage sparked a trend of aestheticized violence in television fiction series. Spoiler alert!

headline: In France, accessible beaches help 'normalize vacations' for all
description: The 'Handiplage' label, awarded to 150 beaches across France, guarantees people with reduced mobility access to the water and amphibious wheelchairs for swimming.

headline: Urban forests spread their cover in a time of climate change
description: Many local French authorities have implemented their own 'tree plan' or 'canopy plan' to increase greenery in cities. However, there is a risk that these initiatives amount to mere publicity stunts or that the trees do not have proper conditions to thrive.
